intro: Lorentea castelloniana, commonly known as the Castelloniana bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and narrow leaves. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
